intro: Helopus, commonly known as the common helopus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in the summer months. The plant is native to various regions in Europe and parts of Asia, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its root system is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Helopus is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
